wikipedia_page.main: Steven Aizlewood (9 October 1952 – 6 August 2013) was a Welsh professional footballer and a Wales Under-23 international defender.

response: **Steve Aizlewood, 60, footballer (Newport County A.F.C., Portsmouth F.C.).
* 6 August 2013: Steve Aizlewood, 60, former Newport County, Swindon Town and Portsmouth defender.
*8 August 2013: Former Swindon Town defender Steve Aizlewood dies, aged 60, after a short illness.
* Steve Aizlewood, 60, Welsh footballer (Newport County, Portsmouth).Former Newport County defender Steve Aizlewood dies

Poole was a member of the Cardiff City academy and joined the Newport County Academy as a scholar in June 2014. In September 2014, he was on trial at Manchester United before he had made his debut for the Newport County first team.Poole trial at Manchester United His Newport County debut came on 20 September 2014, at the age of 16 years and 94 days, when he was named in the starting line-up for a League Two match against Shrewsbury Town which ended in a 0–0 draw.Poole Newport County debut Poole became the youngest Newport County player, surpassing the record set by Steve Aizlewood in 1969. He retained his place for the EFL Trophy first round match against Swindon Town on 23 September 2014. Swindon won the game 2–1.Poole v Swindon In February 2015, Poole was shortlisted for the Football League Apprentice of the Year award.Poole shortlisted for Football League award On 18 May 2015, Poole had a one-week trial with Liverpool.Poole trial at Liverpool

He made his senior debut for Newport County aged 16 in the Football League Cup first round match versus Southend United on 8 August 2017 as a late second-half substitute. Newport won the game 2–0. His debut aged 16 years and 255 days made him the third youngest ever County player behind Regan Poole and Steve AizlewoodFoulston debut
